title: Drawing, "Designs for Teapot, Trays and Salt Shaker", ca. 1928
inscribed: In graphite, upper right edge: Salt + pepper/ casarole/candle stick; 3" high 8 diam.; Butter/[crossed out word]/ pl(?) (???); in graphite, lower right: 33
provenance: Estate of Ilonka Karasz, LAMA sale, December 4, 2005, lot 117; Historical Design, New York, NY
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Various designs for tea or coffee pots, candle stick, salt and pepper shakers, serving plates, cassarole dish.

exhibitions.title: Looking Forward/ Looking Back: Recent Acquisitions in 20th- and 21st-Century Design

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Designs for Teapot, Trays and Salt Shaker", ca. 1928.
ca. 1928. Graphite on tracing paper. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 2006-16-2.
